title: Boosted Accounts.
body:
This is a serious question for riot, why is it that we as a community, actually have to be the ones to point out Boosted/Bought accounts?

Like legitimately, boosting wouldn't be a problem if you guys actually combated it somewhat, because if people were obviously being banned for it, then less people would actually go ahead and do said boosting/buying of accounts.

I ask this question after having been in a game with a blatantly obvious one.

Mid laner that was calling me shit, as a gold 2 with a 35% win rate, that was Plat 1 last season, changed from being a full ADC main to mid lane, and on top of all this, actually changed flash keys from last season to this.

Why do i need to do your guys job and point this out to you?

I legitimately question how you guys manage to avoid finding these guys when they are so damn obvious.

I sent in a ticket, but regardless, i shouldn't have had to do that, and it kinda makes me sad, because you guys clearly don't move to combat this and actually stop boosting/buying of accounts.

replies.body:
It is hard to make an automated system to detect such things accurately, and ain't nobody got the time to personally  do in depth research into every one of the thousands of accounts on each server.

Things like changing role or flash key assignment, do not necessarily constitute a boosted/traded account.
Maybe they got bored of ADC, and wanted a change? Maybe they read that article on summoner spell key allocation and decided to swap?
These things are not evidence in themselves, they only prove to support something more concrete.

>flash key assignment

You seriously want me to buy that anyone actually changes their flash key?

Plus it would be so simple for a Flash Key Assignment change, for Riot to then do an IP check, and boom, bunch of boosters get caught.

It's pretty hard to detect players boosting accounts, they could just be smurfing.... 

as well as the IP checks riot don't ban people from playing on different IP addresses lol

>It's pretty hard to detect players boosting accounts, they could just be smurfing....

They could just be smurfing, is not a reasoning when they go from being amazing to being terrible, or from being terrible to being amazing.

Smurfing is completely different to boosting in that you can tell when someone is boosting because they get those sort of win rates FROM WHEN THEY START PLAYING.

IDK. 

I have a smurf in silver/gold and it only had a <50% win rate in the first 50 games. Now im actually trying to climb them, i've won over 75% of my games. 

Am i being boosted? Nope. 

Although i completely agree the number of boosted monkeys on the OCE server is really high.

Yes but my point is you wouldn't change IP's and then instantly go from 50% to 75%, let alone also change your flash key.

And they all, always happen at the same time.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=8bww7meL,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-09-11T06:34:20.700+0000)
>
> You seriously want me to buy that anyone actually changes their flash key?
> 
> Plus it would be so simple for a Flash Key Assignment change, for Riot to then do an IP check, and boom, bunch of boosters get caught.

Dude, firstly I'm playing devils advocate.
Secondly, did you read the article I mentioned? It made pretty good arguments that may convince some people to change.
Personally, I use flash on either key, depending on what the other summoners is. If I'm using mark, that goes on D with flash on F, anything else goes on F with flash on D, and every now and then, I don't even take flash (shaco, hec, etc).

You're mistaking _suspicious account behaviour_ with _proof_.
Riot need to be **certain** of an infringement to take action, not something as flimsy as "he changed flash key, BANHAMMER!!!".
If you can't see how weak your argument is, then there is no point in this discussion.
What if the cops said "that person has many people coming and going from their house, lets arrest them for drug supply", that wouldn't be legit, just like your argument.

It comes down to player-base numbers and Profit margin.


OCE costs alot of money to maintain, They dont care who uses the accounts, as long as they are buying RP. 

You can share accounts, boost, lend, and anything else that you can think of.

**Anything goes on OCE.**


The worst you will get is a chat restriction. 

**Its very sad.
**

i know the OCE riot staff read posts like this. I actually feel for them. because they put up with the same shit we do. but cant do anything about it.



The stupid thing is,


If accounts were screened _(would require more funds)_ and we curved the way players behave on OCE and encouraged change. (would require a radical change) Numbers for our server would increase.

> [{quoted}](name=Tunasalad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=8bww7meL,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-09-11T10:37:29.548+0000)
>
> It comes down to player-base numbers and Profit margin.
> 
> 
> OCE costs alot of money to maintain, They dont care who uses the accounts, as long as they are buying RP. 
> 
> You can share accounts, boost, lend, and anything else that you can think of.

For most free to play games, the number of accounts that actually spend money, is usually below 10%. Perhaps LoL has more, I do see a lot of people with skins (in ARAM where you can't always pick your 'main'), but who is to say which were purchased and which were free.
In saying that, you'll probably (I don't play ranked) see far more skins, the higher up the ranks you go. Very few in Bronze V, most players using skins in Diamond+.

Those that do spend money, tend to spend regularly, only a few like myself have bought small amounts of RP but seldom. I have spent about $40-50, which I consider a fair contribution for a player that only enjoys limited aspects of the game (ARAM only). Most of the money made, comes from a small group that spends big, or spends regularly. All the players that play for free, keep numbers up and the player base in a healthy state. Pay to play or subscription based games tend to have much lower numbers of players, which is fine for PvE, but bad for PvP.

Account sales, boosting, etc, are negative to the financial side of the game to Rito.
An account that has had RP purchased on it, and is subsequently sold to another player, via 3rd party trading, is denying Rito the cash that the purchasing player would otherwise spend to get those skins, etc.
Rito gain no money from 3rd party spending, be it account sales or boosting services, and it is against their best interests to not discourage 3rd parties making money off their product/service.
So stop with the talk that they don't care because $$$, because that's just plain false.
